official_title: A bill to suspend periodic reviews of disability beneficiaries having mental impairments pending regulatory reform of the Social Security disability determination process.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Disability Determinations Reform Act of 1983 - Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to immediately suspend implementation of periodic reviews of disability cases to determine continuing eligibility for those individuals receiving benefits under titles II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) and XVI (Supplemental Security Income) of the Social Security Act whose disability is based on mental impairment until: (1) the Secretary of Health and Human Services fully examines the disability determination process with respect to cases of mental impairment and makes any necessary revisions in such process; (2) the Secretary reports to Congress the results of such examination; and (3) Congress approves by resolution such examination and any revisions by the Secretary. Exempts from such suspension of review any case where a termination of benefits is based upon a finding: (1) that the beneficiary is engaging in substantial gainful activity; (2) of fraud; or (3) which is based on a scheduled review of which the beneficiary was notified upon initial entitlement. Requires the Secretary to notify individuals with respect to whom a periodic review is in progress that such review shall be suspended pursuant to this Act. Sets forth requirements for redeterminations of disability evaluations made: (1) on or after the enactment of this Act and before the date on which Congress approves the examination and revisions of the disability evaluation process made by the Secretary; and (2) between February 28, 1981, and the date of enactment of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to suspend periodic reviews of disability beneficiaries having mental impairments pending regulatory reform of the Social Security disability determination process.
